user_instruction: 'Compose an email to Emily (emily@communityunited.org), the head of non-profit to discuss how we can boost our donation effort. You can check out my Gmail and Notion for information.'

formatted_items.content:
Summary of John’s recent material related to Community United & donation-boosting work with Emily

1. Email correspondence (all between mid-January and mid-February, recent collaboration thread)
   • “Innovative Donation Strategies” (late January): John proposed digital campaigns, gamification, local-business partnerships, and recurring-giving programs; asked Emily to set up a brainstorming call.  
   • “Upcoming Community Event” (mid-January): invitation for Community United to co-host a local networking/engagement event.  
   • “Thank You for Your Support” (late January): appreciation note; John reiterated willingness to help with future Community United projects.  
   • “Joint Fundraiser Planning” (early February): John listed open items—venue & date, target fundraising amount, and promotion plan—and asked for a quick call to finalize details.  
   • “Fundraising Gala Success” (mid-February): congratulations on Community United’s gala; John offered assistance with donor follow-ups.

   Key commitments already made
   – John committed to:  
     1) schedule/attend a strategy call,  
     2) help finalize event logistics (venue, date, goal, promotion),  
     3) support donor follow-up tasks,  
     4) provide general assistance for future CU initiatives.

2. Notion workspace highlights (last edited early June)
   • “Donation Strategy Meeting Minutes”  
     – Focus areas: grow recurring-gift program, enhance donor-recognition efforts, launch youth-oriented social-media challenges, and protect donor privacy.  
     – Suggested immediate actions: craft messaging for recurring gifts; design recognition tiers; map out a social-media challenge calendar.

   • “Fundraising Event Ideas”  
     – Shortlist: virtual marathon, online concert with local artists, community art auction.  
     – Note: Each concept includes potential sponsor tie-ins and low overhead.

3. Consolidated action items for the next email to Emily
   1) Propose dates/times for the long-awaited planning call.  
   2) Provide two-to-three venue/date options for the joint fundraiser.  
   3) Suggest a preliminary fundraising target (align with CU’s recent gala momentum).  
   4) Share a draft promotion outline—digital campaign + local-business partnerships + youth social-media challenge.  
   5) Introduce the recurring-giving and donor-recognition concepts from June meeting notes.  
   6) Float preferred event format(s) (virtual marathon, online concert, art auction) for her feedback.  
   7) Confirm John’s availability to help with donor follow-ups and any post-event reporting.

This should give you everything needed to craft an informed, forward-moving note to Emily.

1. Email correspondence (all between mid-January and mid-February, recent collaboration thread)
   • “Innovative Donation Strategies” (late January): John proposed digital campaigns, gamification, local-business partnerships, and recurring-giving programs; asked Emily to set up a brainstorming call.
